lines.text: This is where I want to go when I die.
You can have my share of it. I'd rather have an alley in Rochester than all the streets in Paris.
Oh, Dad. But, this place is perfectly swell.
How often have I told you not to say swell?
Sorry, darling. I shan't use it again. But, it is a nice place, don't you think?
Nothing but a lot of jazz bands, dancing, champagne, whoopee! That's all the French think about.
Darling, I love you. Goddess.
Oh, you!
Yes. Don't be afraid of me.
What are you doing like that?
[Toto is dressed in disguise]
Oh, I can't live without you.
Oh, stop, please.
You must believe me.
I'll never believe you again.
Do you suppose I'd masquerade like this if anything in the world mattered but you?
Ah, Bonjour, Monsieur. This is in deed a pleasure to have you here in my home.
Now, look here, young man. I want you to stop molesting my daughter.
Oh, now I know all about you.
Oh, really?
Why, back in Rochester, we only consider your type of a man a lounge lizard. Just a common, ordinary garden variety of boudoir baboon.
Well, I won't deny it.
If you want to live, you must obey my orders implicitly.
Of course I will, Doctor. I want to follow your orders. You don't think I want my aorta to burst, do you? Give me orders. Give me a lot of orders. Enough to do me a long time.
First of all, you must avoid all excitement.
Yes sir.
You must stop drinking entirely.
Not even a glass of wine at dinner?
Not a drop. But, most important of all, you must give up your career as a great lover.
But, I have given up that career.
But, you must give up on women entirely.
Oh, there's only one woman in my life, now.
That's one too many.
What? Why, I couldn't do with less. Did you know that one is next to none at all?
That's enough to put you in the grave.
Please, please, I've got to get a professional nurse, if you don't mind.
Do you suppose I'd let some strange woman come in here and nurse you back to health, again?
This is a male nurse.
Oh, but men are so awkward. Besides, I'm a wonderful nurse. Didn't I take care of my first husband, until...
Until what?
Until he died in my arms.
There, now be quiet, dear and I'll be back in a jiffy.
Be back in a what?
In a jiffy!
She's coming back in a jiffy, oh...
Florine. Hello, Florine.
Hello, darling.
I'm sorry about the medicine, but, you see, it's the doctor's orders.
I know, I was so shocked to hear about it.
Oh, shhh... not so loud.
I was so shocked to hear about it. I've come to nurse you. Look, I'm all prepared.
That's very nice of you, but, you see, see, Auguste will look after me.
I know, but Auguste could never do the intimate little things for you that I will do.
I'll say he wouldn't.
I'm sick, don't bother me.
I know you are, dear. But, everything be alright. I'll bring you back to your health.
You're not going to do me a bit of good.
Yes, I will. You stay right here in bed and I'm going to change my clothes. I'll be back in two shakes of a lamb's tail.
Two shakes of who's tail?
You know, lamb, baaa...
Are you feeling better, darling? What's the matter?
Oh! What are you doing here!
That's my night nurse.
What are you doing here!
That's my day nurse.
I'll night nurse you!
There's a gentlemen downstairs to see you, monsieur.
Who is he?
He says he's the husband of one of these ladies.
Is he fat?
Is he bald?
Is he tall?
Yes. He's crazy and he has a gun.
Show him in.
[Shot fired]
He's in.
I have bad news.
What?
Father's taking me back to America, tomorrow.
Oh, I'm desolate, cherie, but, but...
What's the matter?

Well, I'm sorry, you see, but I haven't been feeling well and I'm just a bit nervous. But, after all, that's life, isn't it. Still, it does seem a pity that we couldn't have had one hour of love, together.
We will.
Will we?
I can slip away tonight.
Tonight? Oh, but, your reputation.
Oh, no matter my reputation. You must hold me in your arms. I must feel your kisses on my lips before I go.
